column4: Hi how can I find out what driver I am using for my video card  this is the card I am using ATI Technologies Inc RV670PRO [Radeon HD 3850]
maybe just looking in /etc/X11/xorg.conf would be easier, I'm not seeing it in your lsmod
is there a way that I can grep the temperature and the driver version screen resolution and Hz?
not sure about grepping all of that
if I could at least grep the temperature it would be nice
not sure, you need sensors in there first off to get the temp or else it's just going to be a bad guess
but there are programs that can monitor temps like gkrellm
I understand I was asking this since I want to use it in a conky and can't find a way to visualise it :-(
try ${execi 90 sensors | grep "CPU Temp:" | cut -c12-16 ;}C in your conky conf
but that would give me the temperature of my normal cpu but not the temp of my video card cpu right
